analysis:
试题解析：A. 两个锐角的和是锐角，错误；
B. 在同一平面内，如果a⊥b，b⊥c，则a⊥c，错误；
C. 同位角相等，错误；
D. 在同一平面内，如果a//b，b//c，则a//c，正确.
故选D.

data.queSource: 2015~2016学年湖北武汉江岸区初二上学期期中第71~75题10分

data.content:
Culture shock isn't a clinical term or medical condition. It's simply a common way to describe the confusing and nervous feelings a person may have after leaving a familiar culture to live in a new and different culture.      1      Those can be exciting, but those can also be overwhelming. You may feel sad, anxious, frustrated and want to go home.

Everyone may feel the pressure to change himself to fit in at one time or another---whether they've lived in the area for days or years.      2      All of your experiences before you come to your new home are part of you and what makes you special.

The following tips may help you live in a new culture more easily and make sure the new culture doesn't overpower the old.

Teach people your culture. You're the one who meets the new culture, but it doesn't mean you should be the one doing all the learning. Take the opportunity to teach your classmates and new friends about your culture.      3      Invite them for traditional dishes from your culture, or show them how you celebrate your holidays.

Find a support group. Find people in your class or neighborhood who have recently moved here, too. You can share experiences, cheer each other up when things get difficult.

Keep in touch with home. You probably left behind your good friends and family when you moved. If it's going to be a long time until your next visit, keep in touch.      4      You not only left behind people, but also other things, like your favorite spots to hang out. Keep pictures around to remind you of home.

Remember, the key to getting over your culture shock is to understand the new culture and find a way to live comfortably within it while keeping true to the parts of your own culture that you value.

It's also important to be yourself. Try not to force yourself to change too fast or too many things all at once.      5      As long as you find a good combination between old and new cultures, you'll be fine.
analysis: 根据下一句话的提示，可知空格处提到了一种会让人激动但也可能会令人难以接受的东西，结合选项，可知指的是到达一个陌生的地方之后面对的变化，因此选C。
根据下一句话的提示，可知你的经历会使你变得独一无二，因此可以推知空格处讲的是没必要全部改变自己，因此选B。
空格处前一句讲到了要和同学、新朋友分享自己原有的文化，空格处进一步解释说这也会帮助他们更多地了解你。因此选G。
空格处前面一句话讲到了要和家人以及朋友保持沟通，空格处进一步介绍了沟通的方式，因此选D。
空格处前一句话讲到了change too fast or too many things all at once，可知这里是在讨论改变的节奏，因此选E。
data.queSource: 2017年北京大兴区高三一模第71~75题10分

answerOptionList.content: Making friends who aren't new to the culture may help you understand the new culture better.
But don't feel that you need to change everything about yourself so you can stand out less.
When you move to a new place, you're bound to face a lot of changes.
Write letters, send emails, and make phone calls so that you can learn about the things happening there.
You will have your own pace of adjusting.
But the good news is that culture shock is temporary.
It will also help them to learn more about you in the process.

data.content:
Do you know Sweden（瑞典）? It l            in the north of Europe. It is the fourth largest country in Europe with an a            of 450, 000 square kilometers and the population of about 8.5 million. Over one third of them live in the three largest cities, namely Stockholm, Goteborg and Malmo. More than half of Sweden is c            with trees. It is one of the r            countries in the world. About 100 years ago Sweden became industrialized（工业化）. Today less than one third of the people are f            .

Sweden is the country where the famous Nobel Prizes are awarded. Many people who have been to Stockholm, the c            of Sweden, must have visited the places where Nobel Prizes are awarded.

The first language of Sweden is Swedish. English is the first f            language in schools. Many middle-school students can s            two to three languages. Most of the Swedish people, men and women, o            and young, can speak English. So there is no p            to speak with them in English.

data.content:
"G20" was born on September 25th, 1999.You must be seeing the word "G20", or "the group of the G20" everywhere recently. But do you know what it is exactly? And why is so important?

G20 is made up of the world's most important 20 economies（经济体）-the European Union and 19 countries. It includes both developed countries like the US and Germany, and developing countries like Brazil and China. The G20 members cover about two-thirds of the world's population and control 85 percent of the world's economy.

This year, from September 4th to 5th, the 11th G20 Leaders Summit（峰会）was held in Hangzhou, China. It's the first time that China has hosted a global economic summit.

"This is a good chance for China to exercise its power in a global（全球的）economics." Said Cheng Fengying, a researcher from the China Institute of Contemporary International Relations.
analysis: 细节题。根据第一段第一句 "G20" was born on September 25th, 1999.可知该句表达正确。
细节题。根据第二段第二句 It includes both developed countries like the US and Germany, and developing countries like Brazil and China.可知该句表达错误。
细节题。根据第二段最后一句 The G20 members cover about two-thirds of the world's population and control 85 percent of the world's economy.可知该句表达正确。
细节题。根据第三段第一句 This year, from September 4th to 5th, the 11th G20 Leaders Summit（峰会）was held in Hangzhou, China.可知该句表达错误。
细节题。根据图片所列国家信息，可知Columbia现在没有加入G20。所以判断为正确。
data.queSource: 2016~2017学年四川成都武侯区初三上学期期末第61~65题10分

answerOptionList.content: China and the US are both developing countries.
2/3 of the world's population are members of G20.
The 2016 G20 Leaders Summit was held in Suzhou, China.
Columbia, a country from South America doesn't join G20 at present.

data.content:
题目一

假如你是李华， 你在向你的英国笔友Peter 介绍参观北京科技馆的活动。请你用英语写一封电子邮件，简要叙述参观的过程，以及你的感受。

提示词语：the Beijing Science and Technology Museum ( in Chaoyang District ), take, excited,

          Inventions, scientific exhibitions, experiment

提示问题：

1. Where is the Beijing Science and Technology Museum?

2. Who did you go with? What did you do there?

3. How did you feel?

Dear Peter,

How is it going?

I'm writing to tell you my visit to the Beijing Science and Technology Museum.                  

Yours,

Li Hua
answer:
Dear Peter,

How is going? I'm writing to tell you my visit to the Beijing Science and Technology Museum. The Beijing Science and Technology Museum is in Chaoyang District. Last Sunday, I visited it with my classmates. We started off at six from Pinggu. It took us an hour and a half to get there by bus. Although we were very excited when we saw the museum, we went into the museum in two lines. After we got into it, we saw many new inventions and scientific exhibitions. We listened to the teacher there carefully and got a lot of from their clear explanation. Then we took some photos and did some experiments. Each of us had a good time.

On my way back, we still talked about the visit. I felt quite happy and hoped to visit it again in the future.

Yours

Li Hua
analysis:
It takes sb. some time to do sth.     某人花费时间做某事

get into    进入

take photo    拍照
data.queSource: 2016年北京平谷区初三一模第66题15分

data.content:
I have the opportunity to live and work in the north as well as in the south of China, and the impression I got is that there are two very distinct Chinese looks. The northern girls are generally taller, of fairer and smoother complexion and mostly with double eyelids and sharper noses, as compared with their sisters in the south, especially those in Guangdong, Guangxi and Hainan!

So who is representative of the Chinese beauty? My guess is the northern girl. Most models are tall, seldom see a short one. The very fact that southern girls has prepared to spend thousands of yuan and undergo painful surgeries to change their single eyelids into double lid to prop up their flat noses, tells me my guess is not too far off the mark.

Action speaks louder than words, so while they may not openly admit it, their action implies that they also think the northern features are nicer!

Unfortunately they don't realize that one can't change nature, and they pay a dear price with botched surgeries resulting in broken noses, swollen eyes, and one of them even died on the operating theater in Korea, where many flock to for that beauty job to be done on them!
data.queSource: 2014~2015学年江苏南京鼓楼区南京师范大学附属中学树人学校初一下学期期中第26~30题5分

childList.content: Where have the writer lived?
analysis: 文章第一段第一句交代了作者在南方北方都居住过。

childList.content: What are not the northern features?
analysis: 第一段倒数第一句里有交代ABD三条特点

childList.content: In the writer's opinion, who is more beautiful?
analysis: 第二段第1,2两句中回答部分答My guess is the northern girl. 给出了作者的看法。

childList.content: The underlined word "representative" in the second paragraph may mean "            "
analysis: 代入推测单词的意思是"代表"

childList.content: From the passage we can learn that            .
analysis: A项是句中作者的引用，B项是作者的看法，也一直围绕这个在写。选B

answerOptionList.content: If a girl isn't beautiful, she can go to Korea to have a surgery.

data.content:
There once lived in China a very foolish king and queen. One day the queen had a      1      daughter. When they saw their baby, they both cried out, "My goodness!      2      small it is! It's hairless and toothless! It's a monster!" They sent for all the doctors in the country and ordered them to      3      some medicine for her.

"When she drinks your medicine, she must grow to the right size and have hair and teeth," the king      4      , "If you don't do this, you'll have a beating.”

The doctors thought it was      5      ,but they dared not say      6      against the king's order. Just then an old doctor stepped forward." Oh, we shall certainly obey your order , "he said," but it      7      time. We      8      dig a mineral from the Kunlun Mountains when the snow melts for the second time. The snow melts on those mountains only      9      in six years. So we need twelve years."

At last the king agreed and the doctors took away the little princess. On her twelfth birthday, they brought her back to her parents with long black hair and beautiful teeth. The king and queen were very      10      and gave the doctors expensive presents.
analysis: 根据后面可知，是刚出世的婴儿
感叹句，how后面加形容词
根据选项可知是为她准备一些药，用prepare
根据语境，国王说，用said
医生们知道过往的要求是不可能达到，选impossible
医生们因为害怕不敢说任何东西反对国王，否定句中用anything
take在这里是花费，耗时间。其他两个，主语不符合
根据上文耗时间可知，他们不得不从山上挖矿物，所以选have to
根据前面一句要挖两次，联系后面一句需要12年，这里是一次需要6年，选once
女儿回来了变得很美丽，国王很开心
data.queSource: 2014~2015学年江苏南京鼓楼区南京师范大学附属中学树人学校初一下学期期中第16~25题10分

data.content: have the opportunity to live and work in the north as well as in the south of China, and the impression I got is that there are two very distinct Chinese looks. The northern girls are generally taller, of fairer and smoother complexion and mostly with double eyelids and sharper noses, as compared with their sisters in the south, especially those in Guangdong, Guangxi and Hainan!

Sandra was a seven – year – old girl. Her best friend was her neighbor, but she moved to another city about a month ago. Sandra was unhappy about her friend's move. Now they send emails and text messages to keep in touch.

There are four students who are worried about some problems and ask Dr. Knowledgeable for help.

Problems

‒ From students

Advice

‒ From Dr. Knowledgeable

What should I do if I failed a test? I'm afraid to tell my mom because she might get mad at me and I can't play soccer.

                        ‒ from Mike		 When you failed a test, it's better to tell your mom the truth than for her to find out another way. Ask her if she can help you study in the future.

I am good at all subjects except English. I can't remember words well. And I am weak in speaking and listening. What shall I do?

                        ‒ from Alice		 It's a good way to join an English club to practice English speaking. And you can make a vocabulary list too.

Whatever I do, I always think about if other people will like. How can I stop worrying about what they think?

                        ‒ from Andrew		 Just be yourself and try not to care about what others think. The more you think about it, the worse you will feel. Just relax.

My dream is to be on the Olympic team for swimming. My dad thinks I started too late and I'll never be able to make it. What should I do?

                        ‒ from Ken

 You should tell your dad about your dream. You can tell him if you work really hard, it might happen even though you start late.
data.queSource: 2017年北京初一学而思

data.content: 根据下列句子及所给单词的首字母，在答题纸上按题号写出各单词的完全形式（每空限填一词）。
data.queSource: 2017年浙江杭州拱墅区初三一模第61~70题10分;2017年浙江杭州滨江区初三一模第61~70题10分;2017年浙江杭州下城区初三一模第61~70题10分;

childList.content: Linda enjoys dancing. It's one of her h            .
analysis: 本题考查词组“one of+形容词性物主代词+名词复数形式”。句意：Linda喜欢跳舞，这是她的爱好之一。

childList.content: I wonder w            he can get to school on time.
analysis: 本题考查宾语从句。“I wonder + whether 引导的宾语从句”。句意：我想知道他是否能准时到校。

childList.content: Tina is losing weight. She looks a lot t            now.
analysis: 本题考查形容词的比较级形式。 “a lot +形容词的比较级” 可以修饰形容词比较级形式的副词有：much, a lot, a bit, a little,far,still, even等。句意：Tina正在减肥，她现在看起来更瘦了。

childList.content: Yesterday Sam had a bad cold and c            a lot in class.
analysis: 本题考查动词和时态。根据句意他感冒了得知是咳嗽。提示词had可知动作发生在过去，所以用动词的过去式。句意：昨天，Sam得了重感冒，在班级里咳嗽地很厉害。

childList.content: N            of my parents liked the movie, but I enjoyed it very much.
analysis: 本题考查代词。Neither表示两者都不。句意：我父母都不喜欢看电影，但是我却非常喜欢。

childList.content: The book is too expensive. I think I will b            from the library.
analysis: 本题考查动词搭配"borrow ... from"从...借。句意：这本书太贵了，我将在图书馆里借一本。will+动词原形。

childList.content: Tom's father is an artist and he spends most of his time d            pictures.
analysis: 考查动词搭配"spend time (in) doing sth"花时间做某事。这是历年中考一模常考的动词搭配。还有两个搭配：1.spend time on sth.  2.spend time with sb。句意：Tom的爸爸是一位艺术家，他花很多时间在画画上。

childList.content: The boor is wide enough for three people to walk t            at the same time.
analysis: 本题考查动词词组"walk through"从中间穿过。往往through和 across的区别是易考点。Through强调从中心穿过，across从表面穿过。句意：这道门足够大让三个人同时通过。

childList.content: The little girl k            her mom good night before she goes to bed every day.
analysis: 本题考查动词的时态。题目中的时间状语every day提示是经常性和习惯性的动作，所以用一般现在时。Kiss good night表示亲吻晚安。句意：这个小女孩每天晚上睡觉前都会亲吻妈妈并说晚安。

childList.content: The first four talent shows were just so-so, but the f            one gave us a big surprise.
analysis: 本题考查序数词。由空白处前面的the可知这里应该用序数词。句意：前面四个才艺展示不过如此，但是第五个给我们带来了惊喜。

data.content: 完成句子。

analysis: 细节题。由第一列第五框第二句“My dad thinks I started too late and I’ll never be able to make it.”可知。故选D。
childList.content: Ken’s father thinks it’s            for Ken to start swimming.

data.content:
There are four students who are worried about some problems and ask Dr. Knowledgeable for help.

Problems

‒ From students

Advice

‒ From Dr. Knowledgeable

What should I do if I failed a test? I'm afraid to tell my mom because she might get mad at me and I can't play soccer.

                        ‒ from Mike		 When you failed a test, it's better to tell your mom the truth than for her to find out another way. Ask her if she can help you study in the future.

I am good at all subjects except English. I can't remember words well. And I am weak in speaking and listening. What shall I do?

                        ‒ from Alice		 It's a good way to join an English club to practice English speaking. And you can make a vocabulary list too.

Whatever I do, I always think about if other people will like. How can I stop worrying about what they think?

                        ‒ from Andrew		 Just be yourself and try not to care about what others think. The more you think about it, the worse you will feel. Just relax.

My dream is to be on the Olympic team for swimming. My dad thinks I started too late and I'll never be able to make it. What should I do?

                        ‒ from Ken

 You should tell your dad about your dream. You can tell him if you work really hard, it might happen even though you start late.

analysis: 细节题。由第二段首句 "The truth is that not all teens who diet actually need to lose weight." 可知。
childList.content: Do all the teens who diet need to lose weight?

analysis: 细节题。由第三段末句 "He or she can help you decide whether you need to be on a diet at all." 和第四段末句 "If you and your doctor do decide that going on a diet is the right thing for you, he or she can help you come up with a plan." 可知。
answer: He can help me decide whether I need be on diet and help me come up with a plan.
childList.content: What kind help can your doctor offer with your dieting?

analysis: 细节题。由倒数第三段末句 "…skim or low-fat milk or water are better drink choices when you’re thirsty – soda and fruit drinks are loaded with calories and sugar and short on nutrition." 可知。
answer: Because they have less calories and sugar and rich in nutrition.
childList.content: Why are low-fat milk and water better drink choices for health?

analysis: 细节题。由末段首句 "…exercising and healthy eating are excellent ways to keep your body in great shape." 可知。
childList.content: How can we keep in great shape?

analysis: 主旨大意题。由全文内容可知文章主要讲了我们是否应该节食，以及如何保持身材。
answer: Whether we need go on a diet and how can keep body in good shape.
childList.content: What does the writer mainly talk about?

data.content:
It seems like every time you turn around, someone is talking about dieting. During gym class your best friend always complains about her "big" hips and how she's going on a diet to get rid of them. This constant focus on weight and dieting may leave you wondering whether you need to go on a diet yourself.

The truth is that not all teens who diet actually need to lose weight. Because teens are still growing, dieting can sometimes be harmful to their developing bodies. Other teens may mistakenly think that in order to be in top form for their chosen sport, they need to be as thin as possible.

The best person to see when you have a question about dieting is your doctor. Your doctor can help you decide what is a healthy weight for your body size and shape. He or she can help you decide whether you need to be on a diet at all.

There are healthy and unhealthy ways to lose weight, and in the long run you are better off taking the healthy route. If you and your doctor do decide that going on a diet is the right thing for you, he or she can help you come up with a plan.

Even without seeing your doctor, you can make smart food choices that will keep you healthy. Instead of chewing （嚼）down on chips when you get home from school, try a piece of fruit or some vegetables.

Simple low-fat substitutions （替代品）can make a huge difference in your calorie intake as well. For example, skim or low-fat milk or water are better drink choices when you’re thirsty – soda and fruit drinks are loaded with calories and sugar and short on nutrition （营养）.

Another thing to keep in mind is that exercise can help you feel and look better. Regular exercise tones your muscles while you burn calories and fat, and it makes you look slimmer. Remember that toning up takes time. Running the mile in gym class once a year won't make a difference in overall weight loss, so start slowly and work up to it.

Whether you go on a diet or not, exercising and healthy eating are excellent ways to keep your body in great shape. Cutting down on the time you spend in front of the computer or TV can help you boost your activity level and may even help you snack less. And research shows that people who exercise regularly are more likely to maintain their new weight if they've lost weight. So, get moving and keep your health on track!

analysis: so that/in order that引导目的状语从句，表示“以便于，为了”。句意为：他们起得很早以便于能赶上第一班车。
answer: They got up early so that / in order that they could catch the first bus.
childList.content: They got up early. They could catch the first bus.

analysis: as soon as引导时间状语从句，意为“一……就……”。句意为：我一到这个新城市就去了超市。
answer: I went to the supermarket as soon as I arrived in the new city.
childList.content: I went to the supermarket. I arrived in the new city.

analysis: though引导让步状语从句，意为“尽管，即使”。句意为：尽管他还是孩子，但他懂很多东西。
answer: Though he was a child, he knew many things.
childList.content: He was a child. He knew many things.

analysis: such...that...引导结果状语从句，意为“如此……以至于……”。句意为：这部戏如此有趣，以至于我们去看了好几次。
answer: It was such an interesting play that we went to see it several times.
childList.content: It was an interesting play. We went to see it several times.

analysis: while引导时间状语从句，表示“当……时”。句意为：那个男孩在下象棋，而那个女孩在读英文小说。
answer: The boy is playing chess while the girl is reading an English novel.
childList.content: The boy is playing chess. The girl is reading an English novel.

analysis: so...that...引导结果状语从句，意为“如此……以至于……”。句意为：她跑得太快了，以至于我根本追不上她。
answer: She ran so quickly that I couldn't catch up with her.
childList.content: She ran quickly. I couldn't catch up with her.

data.content:
从方框中选择合适的连词合并句子。(有的连词可能用不到)

so…that…       so that        even if         though          in order that      such…that…      not…until…         as soon as…        while       where

isn't, for, Chinese, difficult, me

answer: I have got a dog and a cat.

answer: What do you usually do at your birthday party？
childList.content: usually, do, What, at your birthday party, do, you

answer: I'm standing on the Great Wall to talking to you.
childList.content: standing, you, talking to, I'm, and, on the Great Wal

data.content: 请用所给的单词组成语法正确、逻辑通顺的句子。
Let            (I) help            (you).

analysis:
考查be动词。由题意可知：---你是一名教师吗？---是的，我是。由问句you和a teacher

可知，答句应为第一人称单数I，后接be动词am。故填am。
childList.content:
--- Are you a teacher?

--- Yes, I            a teacher.

analysis: 考查be动词。由题意可知：---这些鸟是来自中国吗？---这只红色的是，但这只蓝色的不是。由the red one和the blue one可知，为第三人称单数。but表转折，后句应为否定句。is的否定形式为isn’t。故填is；isn’t。
childList.content:
--- Are these birds from China?

--- The red one            , but the blue one            .

data.content: 选词填空

a:                        the time, please?

b: It is ten o'clock.

analysis: unless意为“除非，如果不”，相当于if not。句意为如果你不给我买新零件，我就修不好你的自行车。
childList.content: I can't fix your bike unless you don't buy me new parts.

analysis: as soon as引导的时间状语从句，当主句为一般将来时时，从句用一般现在时。
childList.content: I think the boy will be happy again as soon as you turned on the TV.

analysis: even though引导让步状语从句，没有even although的组合。
childList.content: Even although children are told fried chicken is unhealthy, many of them still like it.

analysis: such...that...和so...that...都可以引导结果状语从句，基本结构为such+a/an +形容词+名词单数+that从句，或so+形容词+a/an+可数名词单数+that从句。
childList.content: I ran the 100 meters such fast that I won the race easily.

analysis: such...that...和so...that...都可以引导结果状语从句，基本结构为such+a/an +形容词+名词单数+that从句，such+形容词+ 名词复数/不可数名词+that从句，或so+形容词+a/an+可数名词单数+that从句。
childList.content: They are so kind volunteers that they gave all their pocket money to the kids in the disaster area.

data.content: 单句改错。
